section.title: Piecewise-Defined Functions
section.p: Piecewise-defined functions are functions where the formula used depends upon the value of the input. When looking for discontinuities on piecewise-defined functions, you need to investigate the behavior at values where the formula changes as well as values where the issues discussed in might pop up.

introduction.p: This question is all about the function f defined by \fe{f}{x}=\begin{cases}\frac{4}{5-x}&x\lt1\\\frac{x-3}{x-3}&1\lt x\lt4\\2x+1&4\leq x\leq7\\\frac{15}{8-x}&x\gt7\text{.}\end{cases}
Answer at each of the values 1,3,4,5,7, and 8. At the values where the answer to is yes, go ahead and answer ; skip at the values where the answer to is no.

statement.p: Is f discontinuous at the given value?
Is f continuous only from the left at the given value?
Is f continuous only from the right at the given value?

introduction.p: Consider the function g defined by \fe{g}{x}=\begin{cases}\frac{C}{x-17}&x\lt10\\C+3x&x=10\\2C-4&x\gt10\text{.}\end{cases}
The symbol C represents the same real number in all three of the piecewise formulas.

statement.p: Find the value for C that makes the function continuous on \ocinterval{-\infty}{10}. Make sure that your reasoning is clear.
Is it possible to find a value for C that makes the function continuous over \ointerval{-\infty}{\infty}? Explain.

introduction.p: Consider the function f defined by \fe{f}{x}=\begin{cases}\frac{5}{x-10}&x\leq5\\\frac{5}{5x-30}&5\lt x\lt7\\\frac{x-2}{12-x}&x>7\text{.}\end{cases}

State the values of x where each of the following occur. If a stated property doesn't occur, make sure that you state that (as opposed to simply not responding to the question). No explanation necessary.

statement.p: At what values of x is f discontinuous?
At what values of x is f continuous from the left, but not from the right?
At what values of x is f continuous from the right, but not from the left?
At what values of x does f have removable discontinuities?
